meanings.definition: To force upon or impose fraudulently or unjustifiably
meanings.sent1: The salesman tried to foist the fake watch on me.
meanings.sent2: She managed to foist her responsibilities onto her colleague.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to foist a rubber ball as a real egg.
meanings.sent4: He tried to foist his outdated ideas on the team.
meanings.sent5: The con artist would foist worthless items on unsuspecting customers.

meanings.definition: To pass off as genuine or valuable
meanings.sent1: The scammer tried to foist the counterfeit painting as an original.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to foist her homemade cookies on us.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to foist his friend's essay as his own work.
meanings.sent4: He managed to foist his old car as a vintage collectible.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler would foist fake gems as real diamonds.

meanings.definition: To insert surreptitiously or without warrant
meanings.sent1: The spy tried to foist the secret document into the file.
meanings.sent2: She would often foist her opinions into every conversation.
meanings.sent3: The prankster tried to foist a whoopee cushion on the teacher's chair.
meanings.sent4: He would foist his presence into every gathering.
meanings.sent5: The hacker would foist malicious code into unsuspecting websites.
